DataElement.preferredName: Immunization Vaccine Dose Data Source Data Value Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The person or authoritative body who provided the information._The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.:Inoculating an individual with either killed or live agents to prevent contraction of a disease._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
